cleaned_text: | | A Powerful Antioxidant Vitamin C is a major water-soluble antioxidant which increases extracellular collagen production & is important for proper immune cell functioning. It plays key roles in L-carnitine synthesis, cholesterol metabolism, and neurotransmitter synthesis. Intravenous vitamin C (Ascorbic Acid) was originally proposed by two-time Nobel Prize winning chemist Linus Pauling as a way to treat viral infections (such as Lyme, Lupus, and Epstein Barr virus) and cancers.
